translated: Elder’s Birth Stories
The Chapter about Worshipping the Bodhi Tree🔽The Elder Who Gave a Kāsumāri Fruit
Shining like a kanikāra flower,
sitting in the mountains,
I saw the dust-free Buddha,
the world’s chief, the bull of a man.
With a confident and joyful mind,🔽placing my hands together above my head,
taking a Kāsumāri fruit,
I offered it to the best of Buddhas.

analyzed: ekattise itas kappe  yam phalamadadim aha
translated: In the twenty-ninth eon from now,🔽the fruit I offered then,
I do not know of any bad destination,
this is the fruit of offering fruit.
My defilements are ended,
I live without defilements.
How welcome it was for me
I have done what the Buddha asked.
The four analytical insights,
I have done what the Buddha asked.”🔽Thus the elder who gave a Kāsumāri fruit recited these verses.
